Mike and Gordon,
 
Thanks for the very helpful responses: I appreciate it. =
This all worked, for the most part :-)
 
After configuring things as Mike s=
uggests, the crawled stopped immediately. The problem was that the first se=
ed,
 
http://foo.glgdev.com/
 
gets rejected because it doesn't end in .htm=
l! I added a rule after the rejectNonHtml that accepts URLs ending with '/'=
... not ideal, but it got me off the ground so I could test other things. I=
 think what I really want to do is use the contributed decide rule that loo=
ks at content-type instead of relying on the path.
 
Gordon: you're right, =
of course, about the use of the suffix and the possibility of missing conte=
nt that is valid (i.e., foo.aspx, foo.php, etc.). For the purposes of the c=
rawl at hand, since this is an internal site, I have more control over the =
suffixes I'm going to see and can filter appropriately. But in the general =
case relying on extension to *include* files is problematical.
 
Thanks aga=
in for your help, as always.
 
    -tree

 attachments, is intended only for the use of the individual or entity iden=

From: archive-crawl=
er@yahoogroups.com [mailto:archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Mi=
chael Magin
Sent: Thursday, March 29, 2007 4:57 PM
To: archive-crawler@yaho=
ogroups.com
Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] DecidingScope and SURTs



Tom E=
merson wrote:

> How should I go about figuring out what I'm doing wrong. T=
he order of 
> decide rules is:
> 
> rejectByDefault
> acceptIfSurtPrefixed=

> rejectIfTooManyHops
> acceptIfTranscluded
> rejectIfPathological
> rejec=
tIfTooManyPathSegs
> acceptHtmlOnly <--- MatchesRegExpDecideRule with regex=
p .*(?i)\.html?
> acceptIfPrerequisite
> 
> Not only do I seem to be gettin=
g non-HTML files (which I thought would 
> be filtered with the regexp deci=
de rule) but I'm getting stuff outside 
> my SURTs.
> 
> Should the acceptI=
fSurtPrefixed be moved below the others? Perhaps 
> acceptIfTranscluded is =
overriding the setting?

These rules are tested in order -- if you really w=
ant to be certain you 
don't go beyond the SURT scope at all, don't have an=
y other ACCEPT rules 
after the acceptIfSurtPrefixed (except the acceptIfPr=
erequisite -- which 
makes sure that the crawler will be able to get DNS an=
d robots.txt 
prereqs.) Specifically, acceptIfTranscluded is probably allow=
ing a 
number of off-site images/redirects/etc to be fetched, even though t=
hey 
are outside of the exact SURT scope.

Also, if you want HTML _ONLY_, y=
ou probably want to change that rule to 
a rule that REJECTs if NotMatchesR=
egExpDecideRule with regexp 
.*(?i)\.html? The rule you have will merely ac=
cept anything matching 
that, it won't change the ACCEPT/REJECT result for =
things that do not match.

So, I think you might be looking for something l=
ike:
rejectByDefault
acceptIfSurtPrefixed
rejectIfTooManyHops
rejectIfPatho=
logical
rejectIfTooManyPathSegs
rejectNonHTML <--- NotMatchesRegExpDecideRu=
le with regexp .*(?i)\.html?
acceptIfPrerequisite

Mike
